title: Managing Technology in the International Legal Environment
description: Analysis of U.S. and international laws regarding technological innovations from economic, social and political perspectives. Copyrights, patents, trademarks, trade secrets, contracts, products liability and privacy. The Internet, computer programs and biotechnology. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE Area D5 except for Business Administration majors.
prerequisites: Junior standing; completion of GE Areas A, D1 and D2
